title: Three New Figma Buzz Features Unlock Brand Momentum for Marketing Teams

paragraphs.content: Figma has introduced three key updates to Figma Buzz: configurable templates built on design systems, plugin integration, and video trimming. These features enable marketers to create on-brand assets like social media posts and ads without deviating from guidelines. Launched in late 2025 during the tool's open beta, they respond directly to user feedback for deeper customization and streamlined workflows.

sections.title: Design System Integration Powers Flexible Templates

paragraphs.content: Configurable templates in Figma Buzz link directly to design systems, letting brand designers publish components that marketers can browse and customize. This setup prevents brand inconsistency by leveraging properties for layouts, colors, and CTAs suited to platforms like Instagram or LinkedIn. Figma's blog notes these tools help produce "high-impact assets that stay true to the brand."

sections.title: Plugins and Video Tools Boost Workflow Efficiency

paragraphs.content: Plugins provide access to DAM, TMS, and animation tools, with options to create internal or community versions for motion design on the canvas. Video trimming offers precise in-app control for collages and ads, eliminating tool switches. UX Playbook analysis praises Buzz for reshaping workflows in Figma's expanded 2025 lineup.
